title: Fraction Division
text: To divide fractions, we multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.
speech: To divide fractions, we multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.

title: Reciprocal
speech: The reciprocal of , a over b,  is  b over a .

title: Multiplying Fractions

title: Determining the Sign
text: Since the signs are the same, the product is positive.
speech: Since the signs are the same, the product is positive.

title: Multiplying Fractions
text: To multiply fractions, we multiply the numerators and the denominators. So the numerator is $$8p$$ and the denominator is $$2pq$$. The next step is to simplify the fraction if possible.
speech: To multiply fractions, we multiply the numerators and the denominators. So the numerator is , 8 p  and the denominator is  2 p q . The next step is to simplify the fraction if possible.

title: Checking for Common Factors
text: Do $$8p$$ and $$2pq$$ have any common factors?

title: Common Factors
text: We will rewrite $$8q$$ and $$2pq$$ as the product of primes and divide out the common factors from there.

title: Dividing Common Factors
text: We can now divide out the common factor $$2p$$ from both the top and the bottom, which gives us the fraction $$\frac{2\times2}{q}=\frac{4}{q}$$.
